desc: Callback function to handle 'gray-response' events from the server. It decodes the incoming base64-encoded string into a numpy array, which is then decoded into an image frame using OpenCV's imdecode function. This image is stored in a global variable for further use.

line-desc.1: Global declaration of the variable 'processed_frame' to store the decoded image.
line-desc.2: Decodes the base64-encoded string into 8-bit unsigned integer array where each integer represents a pixel value.
line-desc.3: Decodes the integer array into an image using OpenCV, specifying a color mode of 1 (color image).

task.name: demo_1
task.desc: Modify the on-response function to generate a gray-scale image of the passed-in image using the cvtColor function in the CV library. Base64 encode this image and return the result.
